title: Overanticoagulation with Coumarin and Cutaneous Azole Therapy
abstract: Letters15 April 2008Overanticoagulation with Coumarin and Cutaneous Azole TherapyJean-François Alexandra, MD, Eric Pautas, MD, Isabelle Gouin-Thibault, PhD, Virginie Siguret, MD, and Marie-Anne Loriot, PhDJean-François Alexandra, MDFrom Hôpital Charles Foix, Ivry-sur-Seine 94205, France, and INSERM U775, Université Paris Descartes, 75006 Paris, France.Search for more papers by this author, Eric Pautas, MDFrom Hôpital Charles Foix, Ivry-sur-Seine 94205, France, and INSERM U775, Université Paris Descartes, 75006 Paris, France.Search for more papers by this author, Isabelle Gouin-Thibault, PhDFrom Hôpital Charles Foix, Ivry-sur-Seine 94205, France, and INSERM U775, Université Paris Descartes, 75006 Paris, France.Search for more papers by this author, Virginie Siguret, MDFrom Hôpital Charles Foix, Ivry-sur-Seine 94205, France, and INSERM U775, Université Paris Descartes, 75006 Paris, France.Search for more papers by this author, and Marie-Anne Loriot, PhDFrom Hôpital Charles Foix, Ivry-sur-Seine 94205, France, and INSERM U775, Université Paris Descartes, 75006 Paris, France.Search for more papers by this authorAuthor, Article, and Disclosure Informationhttps://doi.org/10.7326/0003-4819-148-8-200804150-00025 SectionsAboutFull TextPDF ToolsAdd to favoritesDownload CitationsTrack CitationsPermissions ShareFacebookTwitterLinkedInRedditEmail Background: Overanticoagulation is a major concern in elderly patients receiving coumarin therapy. Potentiation of coumarin anticoagulants by systemic azole antifungal agents is well documented. However, few data are available about coumarin interactions with topical azole agents (1–3).Objective: To describe 6 cases of overanticoagulation with coumarin therapy in patients treated with topical azole.Methods: Over 25 months in an 800-bed geriatric teaching hospital, all patients older than 80 years of age with an international normalized ratio (INR) greater than 5.0 who were receiving coumarin were screened for cutaneous azole use.
